ext_description.p: A Packaged_part is a type of a . A Packaged_part may be a or a , or additionally may be an . A Packaged_part describes a part that exists independently from any particular assembly on which it may be used.
ext_description.note: The Packaged_part Application object does not indicate that a product used as a component is in a particular product category.

A Packaged_part sometimes is realized by installing one or more occurrences of into a , bonding conductors between appropriate ports on the occurrence of the and on the , filling the void between the occurrences of the and the with an insulating potting material, and marking the realization with an identifier. See Figure 1 for an illustration of a cutaway view of a Packaged_part.

Two Packaged_part models may be exchanged with this part of ISO 10303, depending on usage. One may support the exchange information that maps the functionality of the Packaged_part to the , or dies, included in the Packaged_part; and information that maps the terminals of those instances of to the terminals of the Packaged_part. This mechanism provides maximum flexibility and information exchange and is characterized as a "white box" model. This model is primarily included in the standard to support design to analysis activities. Alternatively, one may map the functionality required directly to the Packaged_part terminals, and not populate the . This is simpler, but does not provide as much information and is characterized as the "black box" model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_part is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Packaged_part as its . There shall be zero or more for a Packaged_part.

specifies the role of the for the Packaged_part. The function specified shall be that mapped by the functional view terminal to physical view terminal allocation requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the that is used to support the enclosed in the Packaged_part. The potting_compound need not be specified for a particular Packaged_part. The potting_compound may form the itself for some technologies when the is molded from the potting_compound.
specifies the of the Packaged_part. There shall be one or more used_package for a Packaged_part.

The function implemented shall exist if and only if the size of the access_mechanisms is greater than zero and the size of the access_mechanisms shall be greater than zero if and only if the implemented_function exists.

ext_description.p: Each member of used_package shall reference the same member of as the version for the supertype of .
ext_description.note: It is not necessary that the and the Packaged_part be the same product, and is often the case that they are not.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Packaged_part_join_terminal is a type of such that an occurrence of the shall not be in the role of an external interface when the occurrence of the associated is a component in an assembly.
A Packaged_part_terminal is a type of that describes a terminal of a . A Packaged_part_terminal may be one of a or a .
specifies the that has the Packaged_part_terminal.

specifies the for the Packaged_part_terminal. The terminal_of_package specifies the role of the for the Packaged_part_terminal. There shall be one or more for each terminal_of_package. If there is more than one terminal_of_package then the member reference different members.

Each member of terminal_of_package shall specify a member of that is specified by the in the role of associated_definition as . No member of that is specified by the in the role of associated_definition as shall be specified by more than one member of terminal_of_package.
The attribute inherited from shall not exist.
